chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Lucas D. Smillie was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--to pay restitution of $250 for Janet Roth

The Court orders entry of a civil judgment for restitution of $2,223.10 to Erie Insurance.  Judgment is to be entered for any restitution processing fee.
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random urinalyses, no less than two times per month for the first 12 months after release from Jail, and no less than once per month thereafter;  by random, the Court intends that there is no more than 24 hours notice of the requirement to take the test
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as directed by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes and employment and educational purposes, as approved by the Agent
--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--to write a letter of apology to Janet Roth within the first six months of the Probation term; to be approved by the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon request

Arresting Agency:  Jefferson PD

The Court orders expungement of this record upon successful completion of Probation, including that Mr. Smillie would have no new criminal conduct and that there would be no attempts to revoke Probation.  The Court clarifies to Mr. Smillie that he will need to petition for expungement within one year of the successful completion of the Probation term. 

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

Modified Criminal Case Settlement

cases #13CF423, #13CF425,#14CF23 called at 10:05am. (separate minutes for each case) 
Defendant Lucas D. Smillie in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey DeLaRosa.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; elements recited; plea of " Guilty " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified (no victim is present; ADA Beck files victim impact statements); the Court accepts the plea, finds Mr. Smillie guilty of Count #1, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 and #3, and Case #13CF425.

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Mr. Smillie on Probation for three years, with conditions:

--to serve 90 days in the Jefferson County Jail, [no work-release], to commence forthwith
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random urinalyses, no less than two times per month for the first 12 months after release from Jail, and no less than once per month thereafter;  by random, the Court intends that there is no more than 24 hours notice of the requirement to take the test
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as directed by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--no possession or ingestion of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes and employment and educational purposes, as approved by the Agent
--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--to write a letter of apology to Janet Roth within the first six months of the Probation term; to be approved by the Agent
--to pay restitution of $250 for Janet Roth
--to pay $25 restitution processing fee
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon request
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge
--to pay officer overtime costs of $84.66

The Court orders entry of a civil judgment for restitution of $2,223.10 to Erie Insurance.  Judgment is to be entered for any restitution processing fee.
Days credit for time already served:  45 days (dates involved are from 1/11/14 to 2/24/14).

The Court orders expungement of this record upon successful completion of Probation, including that Mr. Smillie would have no new criminal conduct and that there would be no attempts to revoke Probation.  The Court clarifies to Mr. Smillie that he will need to petition for expungement within one year of the successful completion of the Probation term. 
Felony firearm/voting prohibition warnings given.
recess 10:38am.
State's (with cover letter)
Status conference on February 25, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on February 5, 2014 at 08:20 am.

Scheduling notice

Case called at
Defendant Lucas D. Smillie in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court has reviewed the criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause to support Counts #1- #3.
Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the Defendant qualifies for SPD presentation.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $1,500.00 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid   
  prescription
-No possession of drug paraphernalia 
-No contact with Janet Roth
-Not to leave the State of Wisconsin

Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within 10 day time limit.

Recess: 1:43 pm
